alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT GARRETT COUNTY... At 546 PM EDT, a snow squall was located near Bittinger, moving east at 30 mph. Locations impacted include... Mountain Lake Park, Oakland, Bayard, Bittinger, Grantsville, Loch Lynn Heights, Deer Park, Accident, Redhouse, Gorman, Jennings, Deep Creek Lake State Park, Crellin, Swallow Falls State Park, McHenry, Big Run State Park, Piney Grove, McComas Beach, Merrill and Keysers Ridge. This includes Interstate 68 in Maryland between mile markers 6 and 30. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this squall. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
